content.prompt: The great grasslands of the world have which of the following primary characteristics in common?

choices.label: They are restricted in occurrence to the region between 30° north latitude and 30° south latitude.
Due to high humidity, fires are uncommon and rarely affect large areas.
They are typically created by overgrazing by livestock.
Seasonal cycles of temperature and precipitation produce abundant vegetative growth.
High winds blow seeds of trees away such that only grasses exist.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
